subject: Communication
title: Asking Powerful Questions
description: A 60-second lesson on Asking Powerful Questions.

hook.text: A closed question gets a one-word answer. An open question unlocks a story.

buildup.text: 'Did you enjoy it?' (closed) vs. 'What was that experience like for you?' (open).

discovery.text: The best questions are curious, not leading. They explore the speaker's world rather than steering toward your own answer.

twist.text: Many 'questions' are actually opinions in disguise: 'Don't you think that's a bad idea?

climax.text: Powerful questions create insight in the speaker. 'What would success look like?

punchline.text: The right question doesn't just get answers.

quiz.question: What makes an open question more effective than a closed question?
